intro: Saurauia parasnathensis, commonly known as the parasnath hill laurel, is a flowering plant native to the Western Ghats of India. It is a member of the Ericaceae family, which includes heathers and blueberries, and is characterized by its evergreen foliage and showy flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and rocky slopes. Its leaves are leathery and dark green, while its flowers are small and white or pink, often clustered in umbels. Saurauia parasnathensis plays a role in local ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various insects and birds.
